data.title: Contact
data.text:
Contact Details and Directions

Peace Research Institute Frankfurt

Baseler Strasse 27-31

60329 Frankfurt am Main, Germany

+49 (0)69 - 95 91 04-0

Fax: +49 (0)69 - 55 84 81

info@hsfk.de

www.hsfk.de

Berlin Office

Chausseestraße 111

Chausseehof, Haus 1

10115 Berlin, Germany

+49 (0)30 - 206 049 120

Press and Public Relations

Dr Stefan Kroll, Head of Science Communication

Phone: +49 (0)69 - 959104-59

Email: kroll@hsfk.de

Please find further information on Public Relations here.

IT support for PRIF employees

The IT department provides remote support for the employees of the institute. For this, the client below must be downloaded.

Download AnyDesk Client

For matters related to PRIF’s website, please contact the Press and Public Relations Department.

How to get here

Directions to PRIF can be found here.

By train or from Frankfurt Airport by public transportation

Please take one of several S-Bahn lines to Frankfurt and get off at „Frankfurt Hauptbahnhof“ (Main Station). Leave the station building through the south gate (when you walk towards to south gate the "mib"-Market is on your left hand side, the tracks of the long-distance trains are on your right hand side).Outside the station, please cross the street and the tram line tracks and go straight on "Baseler Straße" heading to the Main river. After only 200 m you have reached PRIF.

From Downtown Frankfurt by public transportation

The tram stop „Baseler Straße“ is located directly in front of PRIF's building. Tram lines 12, 16 and 21 run here. Frankfurt's Main Station (Hauptbahnhof) is only 200 m away.

By car

Please note that there are no parking spaces at PRIF!

There is a public parking lot (fee required!) at the south side of Frankfurt's main station.

From the North and West

Coming from A 5 via „Westkreuz“ or from A 66 via „Nordwestkreuz“, please take A 648 to „Frankfurt Messe“ (Frankfurt Fair). Entering the city of Frankfurt, A 648 turns into „Theodor-Heuss-Allee“, then into „Friedrich-Ebert-Anlage“ and into „Düsseldorfer Straße“. Please stay on that street, passing the „Messe“ and later the „Hauptbahnhof“ (Main Station) on your right hand side.

Shortly after passing the Main Station, the street's name becomes „Baseler Straße“ and now you also pass PRIF on your right hand side. Make a sharp right at the next crossing and turn into „Karlsruher Straße“. From here you can enter the parking lot at the „Hauptbahnhof Südseite“.

From the East and Downtown Frankfurt

Via „Theatertunnel“(theater tunnel) and „Gutleutstraße“ you get to „Baseler Straße“. Please cross and immediately turn right into „Karlsruher Straße“. From here you can enter the parking lot at the „Hauptbahnhof Südseite“.

From the South

Coming from A 3, please take exit No. 51 to „Frankfurt am Main Süd“ and get on B 43/44 to Frankfurt. Follow this road into Frankfurt. From „Kennedyallee“, make a left into „Stresemannallee“ following directions to „Hauptbahnhof“ (Main Station) and „Messe“ (Fair). Now you cross the Main River on „Friedensbrücke“ and take the right one of two lanes turning to the left. At the „Baseler Platz“ turn halfway left into „Karlsruher Straße“. From here you can enter the parking lot at the „Hauptbahnhof Südseite“.

How to get to PRIF's Berlin Office

PRIF’s Berlin Office is located in the building of the Leibniz Association, House 1, 5th floor, Chausseestraße 111, 10115 Berlin.

The building Chausseestraße 111/Chausseehof is located at the corner of Invalidenstraße/Chausseestraße. Use public transport to get there:

U-Bahn: U6 (underground station Naturkundemuseum)

Tram: M5, M8, M10, 12 (underground station Naturkundemuseum)

S-Bahn: S1, S2, S25, S26 (Berlin Nordbahnhof, 5 minutes walking)

After entering the main entrance, cross the hall straight ahead and take the small glass door on the right (to Haus 2) at first. The atrium is now on the left. Follow the signs to Lift C (Haus 1), which is located at the back of the atrium. Lift C takes you to the 5th floor directly in front of the PRIF office. Alternatively, lift B also leads to the 5th floor.
